definition: perfect/complete
ten/10
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
complete and beautiful/to be perfect (idiom)
no gourd is perfectly round, just as no man is perfect (proverb)
pinyin: gua1 wu2 gun3 yuan2 , ren2 wu2 shi2 quan2

sentences.english: English-Chinese books of translations are not all perfect.
sentences.chinese: 华英对照的翻译书，并非都是十全十美的。

sentences.english: If mand is a type of dog, this is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 如果曼德尔是一个类型的狗，这是十全十美的。

sentences.english: Some units and individuals are also full of luck.
sentences.chinese: 一些单位和个人还图十全十美的吉祥之意。

sentences.english: In the world, there isn't a perfect person. The perfection is to admit imperfect.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界上没有十全十美的人，完美就是承认不完美。

sentences.english: It was perfect, God is always some mortal Jalan will be the others.
sentences.chinese: 十全十美那是神，是凡人总会有些地方会惹着别人。
十全十美，你这可爱的宝贝。

sentences.english: Your emotions are your guiding light, but of course you aren't infallible.
sentences.chinese: 你的情绪是你的指路明灯，但你当然并非十全十美。

sentences.english: The boys were complemented on their neat turn-out.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子们穿上整洁的衣服算是十全十美了。

sentences.english: When she gives a dinner party, Alma always does it up brown.
sentences.chinese: 当阿尔玛举行晚宴时，她总是办得十全十美。

sentences.english: He aims at perfection in everything he does.
sentences.chinese: 他做任何事情都力求十全十美。

sentences.english: This perfection you may, if you please, arrive at .
sentences.chinese: 只要你有志于此，这种十全十美的境界你可以达到。

sentences.english: “Nothing is totally good or totally bad, ” Wu says.
sentences.chinese: “没有任何事物是十全十美或者十恶不赦的，”吴说。

definition: the Three Precious Treasures of Buddhism, namely: the Buddha 佛, the Dharma 法 (his teaching), and the Sangha 僧 (his monastic order)
dragon and phoenix
Longfeng district of Daqing city 大慶|大庆[Da4 qing4], Heilongjiang
gold and jade/precious
nine divide by nine is one (abacus rule)/when all is said and done
Wuxing - "Five Animals" - Martial Art

four divisions (of the twenty-eight constellations 二十八宿[er4 shi2 ba1 xiu4] of the sky into groups of seven mansions), namely: Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2], White Tiger 白虎[Bai2 hu3], Vermilion Bird 朱雀[Zhu1 que4], Black Tortoise 玄武[Xuan2 wu3]

four Confucian injunctions 孝悌忠信 (for men), namely: piety 孝 to one's parents, respect 悌 to one's older brother, loyalty 忠 to one's monarch, faith 信 to one's male friends/the four Confucian virtues for women of morality 德, physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功
happiness and longevity

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
the Eight Immortals (Daoist mythology)
the five flavors, namely: sweet 甜, sour 酸, bitter 苦, spicy hot 辣, salty 鹹|咸/all kinds of flavors
a rare treasure/sth priceless and unique
outstanding people/water and fire (in Daoist writing)
to bewitch/to enchant/to cast a spell over sb

seven emotional states/seven affects of traditional Chinese medical theory and therapy, namely: joy 喜[xi3], anger 怒[nu4], anxiety 憂|忧[you1], thought 思[si1], grief 悲[bei1], fear 恐[kong3], fright 驚|惊[jing1]/seven relations
good fortune/great blessing
